DOC.brief_summary: Prospective, blinded, placebo-controlled trial. Patients: Adult patients (>18 years of age) undergoing de novo Htx, with a preoperative GFR > 60ml/min, not receiving an ABO-incompatible organ with an ischemia time of > 6 hours. A donor age > 70 years is an exclusion criterion together with a severe intraoperative graft dysfunction causing intra-operative death or need for mechanical cardiac support. Intervention: Infusion of h-ANP fore five days, starting at the induction of anesthesia. Outcome: Kidney function, evaluated with serum creatinine and kidney clearance, 4-5 Days after Htx plus after 3 and 12 months.
DOC.brief_title: Prevention of Akute Kidney Injury, Hearttransplant, ANP
DOC.criteria: De novo Htx. Preoperative GFR > 40ml/min/1,73m2. >18 years old. Written consent. Multi organ transplantation or previous heart transplant. Donor age > 70 years. Dialysis. Severe intraoperative graft dysfunction causing intraoperative death or the need for mechanical support. ABOincompatible organ. Ischemia time > 6 tim. Known kidney disease. Other planed study within 2 mounth.
